intro: Pavetta australiensis var. pubigera, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and has hairy foliage, which is a distinguishing feature of the varietal form. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal environments.
